documentationPage.title: Documentation Page
documentationPage.description: This page is intended for vuestic-ui contributors: it will explain how to create and modify documentation.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: Instead of using the established documentation system, such as [vue-press](https://vuepress.vuejs.org/)[[target=_blank]] or [docsify](https://docsify.js.org/#/)[[target=_blank]], weâ€™ve decided to create a system specifically tailored for Vuestic. Itâ€™s meant to provide excellent flexibility for future growth.

pageConfig.title: Page Config
pageConfig.generate: If youâ€™re trying to document a component from scratch, use the `yarn generate:component` command, which will guide you through the process.
pageConfig.description: Documentation has a flat structure - list of blocks. Markdown is supported in all text blocks. Here are the blocks you can use:

title.title: Title
title.text: Page title is mandatory for documentation pages.

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.text: Used for: Examples, API, FAQ. Think `h2`.

headline.title: Headline
headline.text: The block is used to mark titles of examples or to FAQ questions. Think `h3`.

paragraph.title: Paragraph
paragraph.text: Should be used for all non-special text blocks. For links to external resources, you can specify the **target** attribute in markdown markup as follows: `[name](href)[[target=_blank]]`.
paragraph.example: Paragraph (example). Link in the text leading to an external resource: [markdown-it-attrs](https://github.com/arve0/markdown-it-attrs)[[target=_blank]].

list.title: List
list.text: Should be used for list blocks.
list.inCode: Resulting code will look like this:

example.title: Example
example.text: Shows a component with code preview. Component can use all global services: css classes, colors etc.

api.title: API
api.text: API documentation for component. Combines component options with manual declarations.

link.title: Link
link.text: Used for relative (local) links processed by router (with *options* and without them).

alert.title: Alert
alert.text: Used to display an important message.

apiOptions.text: With automated code analysis we can't go too far. Most of the API documentation has to be declared explicitly. API options allow you to configure things such as: version, props, events, methods and slots.
apiOptions.version: `version` - specifies at which version of vuestic this component or feature were implemented.
apiOptions.types: `types` - simpler prop types documentation engine can figure from component options (`String`, `Number` etc). For almost everything else it has to be defined.
apiOptions.hidden: `hidden` - allows you to hide the prop from the API section of the documentation page. As some props could be intended for internal use.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.summaryText: `va-avatar` component is typically used for user profile pictures. The component  helps you display it in different sizes consistently throughout your web application.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default `va-avatar` is displayed as a circle container.

size.title: Different sizes
size.text: The `size` prop prop allows you to specify custom size for an avatar. By default, font size will be scaled depending on the value of the `size` prop. But you can use the `font-size` prop prop to force text size you need.

withImage.title: With images
withImage.text: The `src` prop prop is used to add custom icons to a component.

withIcon.title: With icons
withIcon.text: The `icon` prop is used to display icons inside an avatar.

affix.title: Affix
affix.summaryText: The affix component is created to fix any content in a proper position relative to a container.

target.title: Fixes element relative to custom container.

breadcrumbs.title: Breadcrumbs
breadcrumbs.text: The breadcrumbs component is used for application navigation. It shows the location of the current page within the navigation hierarchy. Itâ€™s used with `va-breadcrumb-item` components.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is a basic usage of the `va-breadcrumbs` component.

align.title: Align
align.text: Changes component position on the page.

separator.title: Separator
separator.text: You can use your own separator and customize its color.

questions.question: Can `separator` prop work with `separator` slot?
questions.answer: No, slot has higher priority, prop is ignored when slot is used. Same is legit for `label` of `va-breadcrumbs-item`, it is ignored when you use `default` slot.

badge.title: Badge
badge.summaryText: VaBadge is used to highlight information related to other element, such as missed notifications on top of avatar.

default.title: Default
default.text: Useful for information views and tables.

button.title: Button
button.summaryText: The `va-button` component replaces the standard HTML button. It offers multiple built-in styles and allows a user to change color and size manually.

default.title: Default
default.text: Just a simple button.

withColor.title: Colors
withColor.text: The `color` prop is used to change the color of the component.

withGradient.title: Gradient
withGradient.text: Itâ€™s used to apply a gradient style to a background.

withTextColor.title: Text colors
withTextColor.text: The `text-color` prop is used to change the color of the button text.

withSize.title: Sizes
withSize.text: The `size` prop is used to fit your button to any place on your web page.

withIcon.title: Add icons
withIcon.text: You can add icons to `va-button` with 2 different props: `icon` and `icon-right`

withConfig.title: Icons as slots with config
withConfig.text: You can wrap your buttons with `VaConfig` and pass icons as slots

withLoading.title: Loading state
withLoading.text: You can add loading state to the button

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: The `disabled` prop prevent any actions with button.

slider.title: Slider
slider.summaryText: The slider component is a visualization for the number input. A user can drag a slider within a fixed range to get the required value.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is basic usage of the slider component.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can customize the color of the slider.

minmax.title: Minimum and maximum values
minmax.text: You can set a range between min and max values.

state.title: State
state.text: Slider can be in disabled or readonly state.

range.title: Range slider
range.text: You can set a range of values.

label.title: Label
label.text: Switch label can have an inverted position or a custom color.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: You can add inputs before and after the slider using 'append' or 'prepend' slot name. Also default label can be replaced using 'label' slot.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can insert icon at the start or end of slider.

track.title: Track
track.text: Track can be hidden or have custom color.

trackLabel.title: Track label
trackLabel.text: You can show track label and overwrite it's view.

switch.title: Switch
switch.summaryText: Switch component turns on or off the state of your custom option

default.title: Default
default.text: This is basic usage of switch component.

state.title: State
state.text: Switch can be in disabled or readonly state.

label.title: Label
label.text: Switch can be labeled on the left or on the right.

customLabel.title: Custom Label
customLabel.text: You can label any state of switch.

innerLabel.title: Inner Label
innerLabel.text: You may put a label inside of a switch.

loading.title: Loading
loading.text: You can mark a pending state of switch.

rating.title: Rating
rating.summaryText: The `va-rating` component is a simple yet powerful element when it comes to gathering users feedback. Just in a few lines of code it can provide you with users ratings about your product or application.

default.title: Default
default.text: The `va-rating` component has a simple interface to collect user feedback.

color.title: Colors
color.text: With `color` prop you can change the color of the component.

size.title: Sizes
size.text: Using `size` prop specify custom size for an `va-rating` component.

hover.title: Hover
hover.text: By using `hover` prop you can see visual changes of value before click.

halves.title: Halves
halves.text: You can divide your `va-rating` component values on halves.

texts.title: Texts
texts.text: A component can be covered by different custom labels for each value.

clearable.title: Clearable
clearable.text: Selecting current value again will clear the component.

numbers.title: Numbers
numbers.text: Want to see numbers instead of icons? We got you covered.

customIcons.title: Custom Icons
customIcons.text: Providing this prop to component allows you to add custom icons.

questions.question: Is rating component keyboard accessible?
questions.answer: Yes, you can use `Tab` `(Shift+Tab)` to move between icons and press Enter to submit value. Or you can use arrow keys (Left and Right) to change rating value

questions.question: Can I use every other prop in combination with **numbers** prop?
questions.answer: Yes, all props are compatible between each other.

toast.title: Toast
toast.summaryText: Component for sending a notification to the user.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, run this component in events by using the `init` method with a setting object.

color.title: Color
color.text: Set different colors using `color` prop. You can either user theme string *HEX* color value.

offset.title: Offset
offset.text: Use `offset` property to set the offset of the toast.

position.title: Position
position.text: Use `position` property to set the custom position of the toast. Available are `top-right`, `top-left`, `bottom-right`, `bottom-left`.

close.title: Close
close.text: You can use close method to close the notification and you can set custom onClose event.

click.title: Click
click.text: You can set custom onClick event to handle the click on button.

questions.question: What is the difference between a component and a service?
questions.answer:
The difference is in implementation. The service behaves more flexibly and it is easier to bind it to certain events than to render the whole element. 
 Each prop you provide to the component you can provide to the service too by using the setting object.

modal.title: Modal
modal.description: Classic modal overlay which represents a dialog box or other interactive component, such as a dismissible alert, sub-window, etc.

overview.subtitle: Overview
paragraphs: `<va-modal>`, by default, has the **OK** and **Cancel** buttons in the footer. You can provide a custom message and title with the `message` and `title` props respectively.

`<va-modal>` supports close on **Esc** (enabled by default) and close on overlay click (enabled by default). These features may be disabled by setting the props `no-esc-dismiss` and `no-outside-dismiss` respectively, or `no-dismiss` as a shorthand to disable both of them.

stateful.subtitle: Stateful
stateful.paragraph: By default `va-modal` is stateless. You can change it by setting the `stateful` prop

fullscreen.subtitle: Full screen
paragraphs: Add the `fullscreen` prop to cover the whole page.
Note that `va-modal` is full screen on mobile viewports by default. You can change it by setting the `mobile-fullscreen` prop to `false`

modalSizing.subtitle: Modal sizing
modalSizing.paragraph: Modals have three optional sizes, available via the prop `size`. These sizes kick in at certain breakpoints to avoid horizontal scrollbars on narrower viewports. Valid optional sizes are `small`, `medium` (default), and `large`.

toggleVisibility.subtitle: Toggle modal visibility
toggleVisibility.paragraph: There are several methods that you can employ to toggle the visibility of `<va-modal>`.

sections.headline: Using `v-model` property
sections.paragraph: `v-model` property is always automatically synced with `<va-modal>` visible state and you can show/hide using `v-model`.

sections.headline: Using `show()`, `hide()`, and `toggle()` component methods.
sections.paragraph: You can access modal using `ref` attribute and then call the `show()`, `hide()` or `toggle()` methods.

disableAnimation.subtitle: Disable open and close animation
disableAnimation.paragraph: To disable the transition/animation when modal opens and closes, set the prop `without-transitions`.

hidingOverlay.subtitle: Hiding the overlay
paragraphs: Hide the modal's overlay via setting the `overlay` prop to `false`.
Note that clicking outside of the modal will still close the modal even though the overlay is hidden. You can disable this behaviour by setting the `no-outside-dismiss` prop on `<va-modal>`.

scrollingLongContent.subtitle: Scrolling long content
paragraphs: When modals become too long for the user's viewport or device, they allow the scrolling of the modal body. Try the demo below to see what we mean.
You can also allow scrolling only content in modal via setting the `fixed-layout` prop. Title and actions will be fixed.

customization.subtitle: Customization
paragraphs: `<va-modal>` provides several slots (`default`, `header` and `footer`), that you can use to customize the content of various sections of the modal.
You can set custom text for **Cancel** and **Ok** buttons via `ok-text` and `cancel-text` props respectively, or you can hide them via `hide-default-actions` prop.
`va-modal` also supports custom `overlay-opacity` as well as `z-index`, `max-width` and `max-height` for a modal.

nestedModals.subtitle: Nested modals
nestedModals.paragraph: Modals can be nested: you can open one modal from another.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.summaryText: The pagination component is used to split big data sets into chunks so that it's simpler for users to use provided information.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default the component is displayed as a list of pages with length equal to `pages` prop value.

colors.title: Color
colors.text: Set different colors using `color` prop. You can either user theme string *HEX* color value

sizes.title: Size
sizes.text: Utilize `size` prop in order to make component fit your needs. Refer to *API* section for more in-depth explanation of how to use `size` prop.

icons.title: Custom icons
icons.text: Feeling the need to change icons for arrows? We have 4 props to enable full customization of `va-pagination` component.

limitVisible.title: Limiting the length
limitVisible.text: By using `visible-pages` prop you can set the amount of pages visible on screen.

withInput.title: Using HTML input instead of pages
withInput.text: With `input` prop you can have input with arrow buttons instead of default pagination.

totalAndPageSize.title: Using `total` and `page-size`
totalAndPageSize.text: You can provide `total` and `page-size` props to `va-pagination` component and let it calculate the length of pagination itself. The value of the component in this case would be equal to the number of the first item at the selected page.

questions.question: What will happen if both `pages` and `total` props are set?
questions.answer: The error will be thrown into the console. Component is meant to be used only in one of these modes.

questions.question: Can I use `total` and `input` props together?
questions.answer: Yep. In v-model you'll get item number instead of page number.

tabs.title: Tabs
tabs.summaryText: The `va-tabs` component can be used as an on-page navigation offering with a rich variety of visual customizations and usage flexibility.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: By default it's displayed as a horizontal list of `va-tab` items

pagination.title: With pagination arrows
pagination.text: When wrapper width is less then tabs width, pagination arrows are shown

vertical.title: Vertical alignment
vertical.text: By using `vertical` prop alignment of `va-tabs` can be customized

stateful.title: Without value
stateful.text: Sometimes `v-model` is too much and in that case using `stateful` prop you can delegate state handling to the component itself

questions.question: How can I map content to tabs so that only specific tab content will be displayed?
questions.answer: We have this functionality in our nearest plans, but for now you could use `v-model` value to map the content yourself

fileUpload.title: File Upload
fileUpload.summaryText: The `va-file-upload` component is an input for selecting and uploading files with a richer interface than the default one.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: By default itâ€™s displayed as a simple button to upload files.

dragAndDrop.title: Drag & Drop
dragAndDrop.text: The `dropzone` prop is used to add drag and drop possibility to the `va-file-upload` component

validation.title: Specify file types
validation.text: Add `file-types` prop with allowed extensions to add file types validation

gallery.title: As gallery
gallery.text: With `type === gallery` prop you can show user picture preview of uploaded files

divider.title: Divider
divider.summaryText: The `va-divider` component is used to separate sections of lists or layouts.

default.title: Simple divider
default.text: Dividers in their simplest form display a horizontal line.

customContent.title: Custom content
customContent.text: You can customize the content on the divider line. Also you can set position of the content by setting the `orientation` property to `left`, `center` or `right`.

inset.title: Inset divider
inset.text: Add the `inset` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider is an inset divider.

vertical.title: Vertical divider
vertical.text: Add the `vertical` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider is vertically-oriented.

dashed.title: Dashed divider
dashed.text: Add the `dashed` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider line is dashed.

form.title: Form
form.summaryText: Need more advanced validation than just `type="email"` over your input elements? **`va-form`** has a solution to offer.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: All elements have `rules` prop which offers flexible solutions when it comes to elements validation. By using this prop youâ€™ll be able to specify exact cases when the field is *valid* or *invalid*.

advanced.title: Trigger validation
advanced.text: You can trigger validation from a parent component by using the `validate()` method of the `va-form` component.

hover.title: Hover
hover.summaryText: The `va-hover` component provides easy access to hover states for any component. To work with hover states you can use either `v-model` or slot-scoped `hover` property.

slot.title: Slot based access
slot.text: You are also free to use Vue default slot.

vModel.title: Default usage
vModel.text: You can use `v-model` to get access to hover state.

questions.question: Can I wrap multiple elements with `va-hover`?
questions.answer: Yes, but they will share the hover state value.

card.title: Card
card.summaryText: The `va-card` is a multipurpose representative component that can be used for anything from links to articles. It has some helper components to make markup easier.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is default `va-card` implementation using `va-card-title`, `va-card-content` and `va-card-actions` helper components.

actions.title: Actions
actions.purpose: The `VaCardActions` component is designed to apply margins and alignment to content (`VaButtons` expected).
actions.props: Two properties can be passed: `align` (**string**, specify how to align actions) and `vertical` (**boolean**, display actions one below the other).
actions.values: Valid values for `align`: left, center, right, between, around, stretch.

questions.question: Can I use `va-card` without helper components?
questions.answer: Yes, if you don't like our styling preset, you are free to use your own.

questions.question: Should I manually set tag if i use link attributes?
questions.answer: No, we will do it for you. If tag is not set, but `href` is, component tag will be `<a>`, if any of router-link prop is set, it will be `<router-link>`.

sidebar.title: Sidebar
sidebar.summaryText: `va-sidebar` is a column to store navigation or secondary information of your app.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage of `va-sidebar`

minimized.title: Minimized
minimized.text: You can minimize sidebar using `minimized` prop

hoverable.title: Hoverable
hoverable.text: Manage your sidebar state using `hoverable` prop. It allows to expand 'va-sidebar' on hover.

position.title: Position
position.text: Align `va-sidebar` to the left or right.

width.title: Width
width.text: Define custom width of sidebar in maximixed state.

color.title: Color
color.text: Change background color of a sidebar.

gradient.title: Gradient background
gradient.text: You can make Navbar background gradient

questions.question: What if `minimized` conflicts with `hoverable`?
questions.answer: No conflict there, `minimized` has higher priority. If it's `true`, hover will not expand sidebar.

sidebarItem.title: Sidebar item
sidebarItem.summaryText: Used as link in your sidebar.

simple.title: Simple usage example
simple.text: `VaSidebarItem` is used with `VaSidebarContent` (to create paddings) and `VaSidebarTitle` (to fill all remaining width in `VaSidebarItem`)

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: You can change sidebar default colors

active.title: Highlight active `VaSidebarItem`
active.text: It is possible to have multiple `VaSidebarItem` highlighted. You can choose your own way to highlight an active item. Even if you want to activate a few `VaSidebarItems`.

icons.title: `VaSidebarTitle` and VaIcons
icons.text: `VaSidebarTitle` used to fill all remaining free space in `VaSidebarItem`. We can also add any other components (like `VaIcon`, `VaChip` or `VaButton`).

image.title: Image
image.summaryText: The `va-image` component is used to display responsive images. It has some features to make your work with images easier.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage of image component.

contain.title: Contain
contain.text: It is used to show a full image while ignoring its original ratio and size.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.text: Change image original ratio, show part of image to fit new ratio.

loaderSlot.title: Loader slot
loaderSlot.text: Is visible when image is loading.

errorSlot.title: Error slot
errorSlot.text: Is visible when `src` path is incorrect.

optionList.title: Option List
optionList.summaryText: The `va-option-list` component is a component to be used to group form inputs (like checkboxes and radio buttons) into a list for better control over the data.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default `va-option-list` will render list of checkboxes provided by `options` prop

withRadio.title: Radio
withRadio.text: Set `type="radio"` to display list radio buttons

withComplexData.title: Array of objects
withComplexData.text: Instead of array of strings you can provide array of objects and specify which key is for each setting.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.summaryText: Checkboxes allow the user to select multiple options from a set.

default.title: Standard
default.text: Perfectly works with `v-model` by default.

label.title: Label
label.text: You can add a label text by setting the `label` property. You can also set the `left-label` property to move your label on the left side of a checkbox.

array.title: Grouped (Array)
array.text: Just add the same `v-model` to multiple checkboxes, and set the `array-value` prop.

error.title: Errors
error.text: You can show your error messages while using `va-checkbox` with form.

progressBar.title: Progress Bar
progressBar.summaryText: The `va-progress-bar` component is used to display an indicator of an app loading content. Also check the [va-progress-circle](/ui-elements/progress-circle) component.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default, the `va-progress-bar` displays a horizontal progress bar. Use the `value` prop to control the progress.

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.text: Use the `indeterminate` prop so that the `va-progress-bar` continuously animates.

coloring.title: Coloring
coloring.text: Use predefined colors or use your own with the `color` prop.

sizing.title: Sizing
sizing.text: Use predefined sizes or use your own with the `size` prop.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: There is also the default `slot` if you want to display some additional info about the progress.

buffer.title: Buffer
buffer.text: When dealing with media content like streaming videos we can use progress bars to show the buffering progress indicator on a video.

progressCircle.title: Progress Circle
progressCircle.summaryText: The `va-progress-circle` component is used to display an indicator of an app loading content. Also check the [va-progress-bar](/ui-elements/progress-bar) component.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default, the `va-progress-circle` displays a circular progress bar. Use the `value` prop to control the progress.

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.text: Use the `indeterminate` prop so that the `va-progress-circle` continuously animates.

coloring.title: Coloring
coloring.text: Use predefined colors or use your own with the `color` prop.

sizing.title: Sizing
sizing.text: Use predefined sizes or use your own with the `size` prop.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: There is also the default `slot` if you want to display some additional info about the progress.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.text: Use the `thickness` prop to adjust the stroke size.

infiniteScroll.title: Inifinite Scroll
infiniteScroll.summaryText: The `va-infinite-scroll` component is a wrapper component which is intended to be used to create lists with dynamically added content. It provides rich interface to customize scrolling behavior and much more.

default.title: Default
default.text: Just wrap your content in `va-infinite-scroll` component and provide `load` callback, and you'll see it's called each time list is scrolled till the bottom.

reverse.title: Reverse
reverse.text: With `reverse` prop you can prepend content to your list. Might be useful in messenger windows.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: In case you need to prevent a list from loading more content, `disabled` prop is here for you.

customTarget.title: Custom scroll target container
customTarget.text: Provide either DOM element or CSS Selector to be used instead of default scroll container.

input.title: Input
input.summaryText: The `va-input` component is intended to be used instead of the standard HTMl input or textarea.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default `va-input` doesnâ€™t have attributes, but can be combined with a placeholder and/or label. It can also be disabled or readonly.

hint.title: Hint messages
hint.text: Support single/multi line messages to give some hint for improve UX

validate.title: Validation and error/success state
validate.text: Support a simple validation using the rules prop. The prop accepts an array of callbacks. While validating rules, the current v-model value will be passed to the callback. This callback should return either true or a String, the error message. Also you can manually pass error/success prop to manage input state.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: You can use slots for pass custom elements to input (inner or outer), such as icons or buttons etc.

textarea.title: Textarea
textarea.text: Support a multi-line `va-input`, useful for larger amounts of text. You can make textarea auto-expandable or manually control min/max number of lines.

mask.title: Mask
mask.text: Support possibility to force/help the user to input a specific format with help from mask prop. You can pass some mask presets or custom options based on [cleave.js](https://nosir.github.io/cleave.js/)[[target=_blank]]. By default returning a raw value.

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: There are tree styles for input: Default (solid), outline, bordered.

alert.title: Alert
alert.summaryText: Alert displays an important message to attract user attention.

default.title: Default
default.text: The basic usage of the `va-alert` component.

color.title: Color
color.text: Use `color` property to change the color of the component.

styles.title: Different styles
styles.text: We have 3 styles available: `color`, `outlined` and `border` styled alerts.

border.title: Border
border.text: Use the `border` property to add a strip and the `border-color` property to change the color of the strip.

title.title: Title
title.text: The `title` property allows you to write text over the description area. Use the `title` slot to costomize the title area.

dense.title: Dense
dense.text: The `dense` property reduces paddings on alert.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: The `icon` property allows you to add an icon in front of the description area. Use the `icon` slot to costomize the icon area.

closeable.title: Closeable
closeable.text: The `closeable` property add a close alert area. Also you can pass `close-text` prop to make close icon as plain text.

center.title: Center
center.text: The `center` property allows you to center title and description areas.

icon.title: Icon
icon.summaryText: The `va-icon` component allows you to use different icon fonts. By default Vuestic UI provides [Material Design icons](https://fonts.google.com/icons)[[target=_blank]].

default.title: Default
default.text: Basic usage of the component with different icon fonts.

color.title: Color
color.text: Set different colors using the `color` prop. You can either use a theme string or the HEX color value.

size.title: Size
size.text: Apply the `size` prop in order to make `va-icon` fit your needs.

rotation.title: Rotation
rotation.text: It is used to rotate the `va-icon` component.

spin.title: Spin
spin.text: You can add animation of rotation of the icon using the property `spin`.

text.title: Text as icon
text.text: Using `text` prop is used to cover the text icon style.

tag.title: Custom tag
tag.text: With the `tag` prop you can attach the icon to another tag.

radio.title: Radio
radio.summaryText: The `va-radio` allows the user to select one option from a set.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-radio` component.

color.title: Colors
color.text: With `color` prop you can change the color of the component.

customLabels.title: Custom Labels
customLabels.text: You can add a label text by setting the `label` property. To switch label side use `left-label` property.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: With `disabled` prop you can disable a user interaction  with `va-radio` component.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-collapse` component.

solid.title: Solid
solid.text: Add borders to your collapse component by using the `solid` property.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can add an icon to the header.

accordion.title: Accordion
accordion.summaryText: Allows you to control group of collapses

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-accordion` component.

multiply.title: Multiply
multiply.text: Accordion component allows you to select multiply collapses.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage of the `va-chip` component.

flat.title: Flat
flat.text: Flat style without borders and background.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can use the `va-chip` component with different colors.

size.title: Size
size.text: Set different tag sizes using size presets.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can use icons in tag.

closeable.title: Closeable
closeable.text: A tag can be closed by applying the `closeable` property.

grid.title: Grid System
grid.summaryText: Vuestic UI provides you with some flexbox helper classes. Of course, you can opt out using CSS Grid instead (or any other layout-scheme you'd like), but if you prefer using flexbox, we've got you covered. Still, the final decision is totally up to you.

breakpoints.title: Breakpoints
breakpoints.text: Use the following classes (`breakpoints`) to apply provided styling to screens of certain widths exclusively.

offsets.title: Offsets
offsets.text: You can use the `offset`-classes to set spaces between a given element and the one to the left from it.

gutters.title: Gutters
gutters.text: Set the margins between the "`cell`s" of you flex-container with the `gutter` classes.

align.title: `align`:
variants: `.align--start` - cross-start margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-start line
`.align--end` - cross-end margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-end line
`.align--center` - items are centered in the cross-axis
`.align--baseline` - items are aligned the way their baselines align

alignSelf.title: `align-self`:
variants: `.align-self--start` - cross-start margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-start line
`.align-self--end` - cross-end margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-end line
`.align-self--center` - items are centered in the cross-axis
`.align-self--baseline` - items are aligned the way their baselines align

alignContent.title: `align-content`:
variants: `.align-content--start` - lines packed to the start of the container
`.align-content--end` - lines packed to the end of the container
`.align-content--center` - lines packed to the center of the container
`.align-content--space-between` - lines evenly distributed; the first line is at the start of the container while the last one is at the end
`.align-content--space-around` - lines evenly distributed with equal space between them

justify.title: `justify`:
variants: `.justify--start` - items are packed toward the start line
`.justify--end` - items are packed toward to end line
`.justify--center` - items are centered along the line
`.justify--space-around` - items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them
`.justify--space-between` - items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item is on the end line

justifySelf.title: `justify-self`:
variants: `.justify-self--start` - The item is packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.
`.justify-self--end` - The item is packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.
`.justify-self--center` - For items that are not children of a flex container, this value is treated as `.justify-self--start`.
`.justify-self--baseline`

list.title: List
list.summaryText: The `va-list` component is used to display structured information.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: Has no attributes by default. Build a structure by using components `va-list-label`, `va-list-separator`, `va-list-item` and etc.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: You can disable any user interaction by using 'disabled' prop.

clickable.title: Clickable
clickable.text: Support a ability to use a list item as a link.

fit.title: Fit
fit.text: Support a fitting of the list item by its content length.

lines.title: Lines
lines.text: You can divide item label content on a custom count of lines.

select.title: Select
select.summaryText: Select field components are used for collecting user provided information from a list of options. This component opens up a menu for the selection list and action.

trackBy.title: Track by
trackBy.text: Track by can be used if you have multiple options with same value.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: Includes prepend, prepend-inner, append and append-inner slots

state.title: State
state.text: Includes error, success, disabled or loading state

chips.title: Chips
chips.text: Includes selection display as chips and maximum chips count

searchable.title: Searchable
searchable.text: Supports ability to filter option list by typing

allowCreate.title: Allow create
allowCreate.text: You can add options that initial options do not have

validation.title: Validation rules
validation.text: Select accepts an array of functions that take an input value as an argument and return either true / false or a string with an error message

keyboardNavigation.title: Keyboard navigation
keyboardNavigation.moves: By using `ARROW DOWN` and `ARROW UP` you can move between options
keyboardNavigation.selects: By using `ENTER` and `SPACE` you can select current option
keyboardNavigation.hints: If you type while option list is opened this will create a search buffer (will reset if you do not type for 1 second) that will be used to search in the options labels

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: Select styles inherit from input styles

parallax.title: Parallax
parallax.summaryText: Parallax is a component where the background image is moved at a different speed than the foreground content while scrolling.

default.title: Default
default.text: A block with a background image is displayed by default. You need to pass the 'src' property.

custom.title: Custom height and speed
custom.text: You can adjust parallax height and scroll speed. Attention, the scrolling speed depends on the ratio of the parallax height to the image height.

reversed.title: Reversed
reversed.text: You can flip the parallax scrolling.

slot.title: Slot
slot.text: You can provide some kind of content over the parallax.

backtop.title: Backtop
backtop.summaryText: The backtop button is used to return to the top of a component.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default `va-backtop` watches for a body element offset height. You can change a target element, positioning and scrolling speed.

reset.title: CSS Reset
reset.description: We use `reset.scss` to reset and normalize basic CSS styles

features.title: Reset features
features.info: Below is a list of features that are provided by reset.scss:
features.list:
* Margin and padding reset. 
 * Border reset. 
 * Hide quotes. 
 * Font reset. 
 * Hidden-attribute fix for newer browsers. 
 * HTML5 display-role reset for older browsers
features.more: For a complete list of all applied styles, see the [reset.scss](https://github.com/epicmaxco/vuestic-ui/blob/develop/packages/ui/src/components/vuestic-sass/global/reset.scss)[[target=_blank]] stylesheet.

colorPicker.title: Color Picker
colorPicker.summaryText: A component which helps to pick the color. We use the [vue-color](https://github.com/xiaokaike/vue-color)[[target=_blank]] library for this component. Will be replaced in next versions.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model`.

colorInput.title: Color Input
colorInput.summaryText: Input component that allows you to select a color.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model`.

selected.title: Selected
selected.text: Dot style changes can be applied.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: All user interactions can be disabled.

advanced.title: Advanced
advanced.text: It's a heavier component which provides an ability to pick color by click.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model`.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model` and palette array.

indicator.title: Indicator
indicator.text: You can apply different styles to the indicator: `dot` and `square` are available.

advanced.title: Advanced
advanced.text: The component has an advanced version with an input component and color picker.

datePicker.title: Date Picker
datePicker.description:
Date picker component allows user to select single, multiple or range of dates, months and years. You can customize it the way you want. There is a option to change all string and formats.

It based on native js dates so you can use this Date Picker with any date library you want.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, use this component with v-model.

mode.title: Mode
mode.text: You can use date picker in three different ways. By default date picker uses `auto` mode. This means that `mode` will be chosen based on `modelValue`. There is three modes: `single`, `multiple` and `range`. Different modes require different model values.

stateful.title: Stateful
stateful.text: Date picker can be stateful. Initial value will be undefined, but user can change it.

firstWeekday.title: First day of the week
firstWeekday.text: If you want to always use Monday as the first day of the week, you can set this prop in GlobalConfig.

weekends.title: Weekends
weekends.text: You can highlight weekends using `highlight-weekends` prop. Also, you can set your own weekends using `weekends` function.

otherMonths.title: Other month days
otherMonths.text: You can show days of other months using `show-other-months` prop instead of blank cells in calendar.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: For now, we don't support localization using one prop. But you have opportunity to localize it by yourself using slots.

view.title: View
view.text: You can set specific view for date picker. With `view` prop you can define how date picker will displayed, year and month that will be shown.

type.title: Type
type.text: If you want allow user to pick only month or year, you can make it using `type` prop.

disabledDates.title: Disable dates
disabledDates.text: You can disable some specific days, month or year using `allowedDays`, `allowedMonth` or `allowedYear` props.

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: You can change colors using CSS variables for deeper customization, but also you can simple change colors using props.

dateInput.title: Date Input
dateInput.description: Date Input component is a combination of Date Picker and Input components. You can find usage examples using following links:

resetOnClose.title: Reset on close
resetOnClose.text: There is a prop `resetOnClose` for range mode. If user selected incomplete range and closed dropdown, then used last complete value.

isOpen.title: IsOpen
isOpen.text: IsOpen prop allows you to force show dropdown as opened.

formatting.title: Formatting
formatting.text: You can pass the format function to VaDateInput which will format input text like you want to. This way you can use any format that you want. For example, you can use [date-fns](https://date-fns.org/v2.23.0/docs/format)[[target=_blank]]

buttonGroup.title: Button Group
buttonGroup.summaryText: It is a special component that wraps buttons and applies special styles to them.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, you need to wrap your buttons with a `va-button-group` component.

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: Component provides color to each child button.

gradient.title: Gradient
gradient.text: Itâ€™s used to apply a gradient style to a background.

icons.title: Icons
icons.text: Looks good with icons provided to buttons.

buttonToggle.title: Button Toggle
buttonToggle.summaryText: The button is used to switch between different values.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, an object with parameters and a v-model is to be passed.

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: Applies color presets and HEX colors.

toggleColor.title: Toggler color
toggleColor.text: Use `toggle-color` prop to set the color of the active button.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.text: You can provide size presets to the component.

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: You can set button styles to the component.

appBar.title: App bar
appBar.summaryText: The app bar component is a part of a websiteâ€™s navigation and itâ€™s an alternative to the header element in apps.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, a `va-app-bar` needs a parent element with relative position.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can set a background color of the component.

bottom.title: Bottom
bottom.text: You can make app bar sit at the bottom of the screen.

hide.title: Hide
hide.text: `hide-on-scroll` allows you to hide app bar when you scroll away.

innerLoading.title: Inner Loading
innerLoading.summaryText: You can handle the loading state of the wrapped component by using the `va-inner-loading` component.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default wrap a component in `va-inner-loading` with a `loading` property.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can change the color of the icon.

size.title: Size
size.text: Supports the ability to resize the icon.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can change the loading icon.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: You can create a new project or integrate Vuestic UI into an existing application. The installation process is mostly the same for both cases: you can either *install Vuestic UI manually* or use specifically designed *Vue CLI plugin*. Both ways provide you with a **full tree-shaking support**. Choose the one that fits your needs the most.
installation.subtitle: If you decide to install Vuestic UI manually, all you need to do is to install a NPM package, a couple of other necessary assets (such as fonts and CSS styles) and slightly modify your application's entry point (most probably `index.js` or `main.js`, depending on your setup).
installation.prerequisites: But first, make sure you've got all the following prerequisites installed:
installation.afterCheck: After checking the prerequisites, install Vuestic UI via npm or yarn:

fonts.title: Assets installation
fonts.description: By default Vuestic UI uses `Source Sans Pro` and `Material Icons` fonts. You should manually add them into your project. In order to do so you can either:
fonts.htmlExampleTitle: include fonts directly in your `index.html`'s `<head>` element
fonts.cssExampleTitle: or include them in your CSS

quickStart.title: Modify your application's entry point
quickStart.description: Import both the styles and the plugin into your entry file. The plugin is used to automatically register all the components, directives and other stuff globally. If you don't want to register everything globally then check out the tree-shaking section below.

cli.title: Vue CLI installation
cli.description: Another way to install Vuestic UI is using the Vue CLI plugin.
cli.attention: Installing Vuestic UI via the plugin would modify your `package.json` and `main.(js|ts)` files, so make sure youâ€™ve committed your code before proceeding to avoid data loss.
cli.prepare: First, make sure you've got [Vue CLI](https://cli.vuejs.org/guide/installation.html)[[target=_blank]] installed globally:
cli.upgrade: Notice also that the minimum supported version of Vue CLI is v4.0.0. In case you've got an older version installed, please, consider [upgrading](https://cli.vuejs.org/migrating-from-v3/#migrating-from-v3)[[target=_blank]] it.
cli.codeAnnotation: If everything's fine then you can finally install the plugin with the following command (**don't forget to commit**):

treeShaking.title: Tree shaking
treeShaking.description: If you plan to use only several components in your application and thus reduce the size of your bundle, you can use the Vuestic ESM build. Webpack (vue-cli) and Vite do that automatically.

example.title: First, you don't need to use `VuesticPlugin` since it registers all the `vuestic` components globally. Instead, you can import specific components from the `vuestic-ui` package.
example.footer: Alternatively, you can import them directly in your `.vue` files.

plugins.title: In such a case you'd also have to register Vuestic plugins by yourself. We recommend to use all of them:
plugins.GlobalConfigPlugin: GlobalConfigPlugin - used for `VaConfig` component and global props reassignment. [Read more](/services/global-config).
plugins.ColorHelpersPlugin: ColorHelpersPlugin - used to create reactive CSS variables. Requires `GlobalConfigPlugin`. [Read more](/services/colors-config).

example.title: All of these plugins are also available through the `VuesticPluginsWithoutComponents`:

attention.cssLoader:
As all components' code is separated, you may need a CSS loader to load component-specific CSS.
But you probably already have one.

nuxt.title: Nuxt installation
nuxt.description: Vuestic UI can be added by adding plugin after installation. Create plugin and include it into `nuxt.config.js`:

manual.title: Manual installation
manual.description: The easy way if you use the Vue-CLI setup or you want to try out the Vuestic on the scratch project.

roadmap.title: Vuestic UI Roadmap
roadmap.description: Our team is constantly improving the existing code base and adding new features that help building applications even easier.

inDevelopment.title: In development
inDevelopment.description: The following releases are currently being developed:

1-2.title: v1.2
1-2.description: We're currently working on new components: `date-picker` and `data-table`

1-0.title: v1.0
1-0.description: Starting point of vuestic-ui. Reworked and added multiple components, added proper documentation.

0-1.title: v0.1
0-1.description: Not even alpha, we've just split components from [vuestic-admin](https://github.com/epicmaxco/vuestic-admin)[[target=_blank]] into separate repository to simplify updates.

longTimeSupport.title: Long time support
longTimeSupport.description: The following versions have continued maintenance for backwards compatible fixes, major bugs, and security vulnerabilities.

archive.title: Archive
archive.description: The following releases are old and unsupported minor and major versions:

accessibilityGuide.title: Accessibility
accessibilityGuide.description: Vuestic UI components support keyboard interactions for all mouse-based actions and utilize HTML5 semantic elements where applicable.

keyboardInteractions.title: Keyboard accessible
keyboardInteractions.description: All the interactive elements on your page (e.g. text boxes, buttons, etc.) can be accessed with the keyboard. That means you should be able to focus them by using Tab and Shift+Tab keys.

configurationGuide.title: Configuration
configurationGuide.description: Vuestic UI comes with a convenient mechanism that allows for a deep icons, components, and colors customization.

colors.title: Color themes
colors.description: You can easily modify the colors used by Vuestic UI components (and even add custom ones):

icons.title: Icon fonts
icons.description: By default Vuestic UI uses **material design icons**, so make sure to install the package:
icons.subtitle: Using custom icons
icons.subDescription: With Icons Config you can use any icon font you'd like by simply transforming the icon names to respective props.

components.title: Components config
components.intro: If you want to set global defaults for Vuestic components â€” we've got a config for that either!
components.description: Letâ€™s say you want all of your buttons to be `outline` and `small` to match your design, but by default that's not the case:
components.action: To solve that problem edit to `main.js` file the following way:
components.result: Now all of your buttons by default will look like this:
components.example: You can configure any prop for any Vuestic UI component in such a manner.
components.more: In case your customization runs deeper consider [overriding CSS variables](/styles/css-variables#overriding) or even directly the `.class`' properties (components use BEM-notation so it should be easy to figure out which selector to address with the help of standard dev-tooling).

browserSupport.title: Browser Support
browserSupport.description: We design Vuestic UI to be future proof. That's why we support modern browsers, but some old browsers, such as IE had to go, sorry. That decision was influenced by [dropped support in Vue 3](https://github.com/vuejs/rfcs/discussions/296)[[target=_blank]] and [falling usage rate](https://caniuse.com/usage-table)[[target=_blank]].

overview.title: What is Vuestic UI
overview.description: Weâ€™ve designed the framework in such a way that it satisfies the most sophisticated design fantasies and allows you to implement them.
overview.featureRich: Contains a **50+ feature-rich components** that can be used in any design solution
overview.configurable: Allows **to configure components** globally via config and CSS variables
overview.responsive: Fully **responsive** and **supports modern browsers** (no IE11, sorry)

translation.title: Translation
translation.description: Translation is only needed for documentation (`packages/docs/locales`) as components don't use any translation strings at the moment. After finishing work on the translation, do not forget to change its status to `full` in file `locales/index.ts`. Here's the current state for languages support:

table.title: Tables
table.summaryText: Feature-rich Data-Tables are currently a work in progress. However, for now you can use plain `<table>`s with the `.va-table` class that would apply Vuestic-theme styles to them. Here is a couple of examples.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: Add the `.va-table` class to the `<table>` element.

hoverable.title: Hoverable
hoverable.text: Highlight hovered rows with additional `.va-table--hoverable` class.

striped.title: Striped
striped.text: The `.va-table--striped` class colorizes each even row of the table.

clickable.title: Clickable
clickable.text: Change the cursor to `pointer` when hovering rows by adding the `.va-table--clickable` class

guide.title: Contribution guide
guide.description: This guide describes ways in which you can become part of the ongoing development of the Vuestic user interface. We are really excited that you are interested in contributing to Vuestic UI.

description.localBranches: `master` branch keeps latest stable release + cherrypicked hotfixes. All development should be done in local branches.
description.dontSubmitToMaster: **Do not submit PRs against the `master` branch.**
description.checkoutFeat: Checkout a `feat/` branch from `develop`, then create pull request against that branch.
description.multipleSmallCommits: It's OK to have multiple small commits as you work on the PR - we will let GitHub automatically squash it before merging.
description.fixBugSteps:
If fixing a bug:
  * If you are resolving a special issue, add `close #xxxx[,#xxx]` (#xxxx is the issue id) to the PR description so that github [will close](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-your-work-on-github/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword)[[target=_blank]] the issue once it's up on `master`.
  * Provide detailed description of the bug in the PR if it's not done in the issue.

branches.title: Branches
branches.publicBranches:
Public branches (**epicmax/vuestic-ui**):
  * `master` - releases and hotfixes only. Do not submit PR's to `master`!.
  * `develop` - main development branch. Houses `2.0` at the moment.
branches.localBranches:
Local branches
  * For local branches prepend your messages with `feat/`, ie for tabs fix it would be `feat/fix-tabs`. This is wanted to keep local branches visually separate from public ones.

forCoreContributors.title: For core contributors
forCoreContributors.assignYourself: When you start working on the task - please assign yourself. That's needed to prevent conflict.
forCoreContributors.smallIssues: For small issues you may push to `develop` branch directly while adding (`close #123`) to commit message.
forCoreContributors.singlePrPerIssue: Create single PR for one issue. If we have several PRs - move all the code into a single one and close the rest. If one PR covers several issues - either split it in several PRs or mark one of the issues as duplicate.
forCoreContributors.onePersonPerIssue: Be sure to have only one person assigned per issue.
forCoreContributors.beProactive: Be proactive. If you think something is wrong - create an issue or discuss.
forCoreContributors.workInBook: If you work on UI components - work in book environment (`yarn serve:book`). We want to keep global stuff out of components.

beforeReleaseWorkflow.title: Before release workflow
beforeReleaseWorkflow.description: Update package versions to newest ones. Update lock files (for both `npm` and `yarn`)

globalConfig.title: Global config
globalConfig.subtitle: With Global config we can configure colors, icons and any prop for any component.
globalConfig.structure: Global config consists of icons, colors and components configs.
globalConfig.setupExampleTitle: We can provide our custom config with VuesticPlugin, if we want to:
globalConfig.reactiveUpdateExampleTitle: Or we can update our config on runtime:
globalConfig.reactiveSetExampleTitle: Or we can set new config on runtime:
globalConfig.useInRuntime: Use global config as reactive Proxy:

api.icons: Used to configure icon fonts and aliases.
api.components: Used to globally overwrite props of specific components.
api.colors: Used to define theme colors that components will use. Here we can redefine default vuestic theme color.

iconsConfig.title: Icons config
iconsConfig.about: By default Vuestic UI provides [Material Design icons](https://fonts.google.com/icons)[[target=_blank]]. If you want to use other font libraries you can configure VaIcon to use them.

problem.definition: There is the problem with icon libraries: they usually use different interfaces to render icons.
problem.materialIcons: For example material-icons want us to set `material-icons` class and provide icon name inside `span` tag.
problem.fontAwesome: If we want to use FontAwesome5 we need to provide `fas` class and then provide class with icon name and prefix `fa-` on `i` tag.
problem.summary: With Icons Config we can simply provide an icon name in style that we want. We need to configure how the provided name will be rendered only one time.

fonts.title: Fonts
fonts.about: We want to use `<va-icon name='icon-name' />` pattern. We can setup config for specific icon name pattern. In this config we can provide icon class, content (innerHTML) or Vue component relative to icon name.

fontNamePattern.title: Font name pattern
fontNamePattern.about: Font name pattern is similar to vue dynamic routes. We can use dynamic segments to dynamically generate icon class, content or props. Dynamic segments should be written in curly brackets.

example.title: Example fonts config
example.explain: Below we can see how icon will be transformed

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.about: To make code simpler we can use aliases. Alias has a `to` prop which will change name on current icon to `to` string and then it will looks for appropriate font config. All props from founded font will be applied to current icon if they was not defined in alias config.

example.title: Example aliases config
example.about: Below we can see how icon will be transformed
example.explain: As you can see alias config is more important than font config. And `va-icon` props is more important than alias and font config.

setup.title: Let's build our config
setup.about: We need to update icons config in our global config. Icons config is a flat array with Vuestic default font and aliases. We can use `createIconsConfig()` helper to create new config with Vuestic defaults and our custom fonts and aliases. For example:

api.title: Icon config API
api.name: String or regex. Can be string with dynamic segment or regex to use this config as font.
api.iconClass: Class that will be applied to icon. Can be string or function, that accepts dynamic segment value and returns string.
api.content: Content that will be inside icon. Can be string or function, that accepts dynamic segment value and returns string.
api.component: VueComponent that will be used instead of tag.
api.componentProps: Props that will be bound to `component`. Can be object or function, that accepts dynamic segment value and returns object.
api.to: Here you can define name of config that values will be merged to this config
api.tag: Tag that will be used. By default - `i`
api.color: Color will be set css style color

advancedIconsConfig.title: Advanced icons config
advancedIconsConfig.subtitle: Icons config is a flat array. VaIcon looks for first appropriate name (strict string, regex or dynamic segment). Then, if config has a `to` prop it looks for additional config that appropriate for `to`.
advancedIconsConfig.priority: Here you can see how its works

componentsConfig.title: Components config
componentsConfig.subtitle: With component config we can override default props for any vuestic component we want. Components config is a object where key is `component name` and value is `component props` which we want to overwrite. For example:
componentsConfig.demoTitle: In example below we can change global style of all buttons on whole Vuestic Documentation site. Feel free to navigate to Button docs page and see how it looks.

vaConfig.title: Scoped config
vaConfig.subtitle: We can use VaConfig to override component props inside `<va-config></va-config>` tag. Components config for all component inside `va-config` tag will be overwritten to `components` prop value. Let's look at the demo below:
vaConfig.explain: Look at the code. In this demo we have changed default color for all our `VaButton` and `VaIcons`. Also we pass prop to third button which value is more important than in scoped config.

api.title: Component config service API
api.ComponentConfig: Object where key is Vuestic component name and value is component props

colorsConfig.title: Colors config
colorsConfig.about: You can personalize colors that are used in our app. You can dynamically redefine colors that are used in Vuestic components. Also, you can add your own colors that we want to use in your app.

example.about: For example, we can change the `primary` color that is used in almost all Vuestic components.
example.demo: You can check the demo below and see how colors are changing all over the page.

reactivity.subtitle: Reactivity
reactivity.about: As you can see, methods like `getColor`, `getColors` donâ€™t return `Proxy`. If you want to use color as reactive Proxy, use computed properties like in the example above.

otherServices.subtitle: Colors config with other services
otherServices.components: You can use your color in Components config.
otherServices.icons: Also in Icons config you can use custom color as icon color.
otherServices.css: Also CSS variables has same color variables as you define in color config that dynamically changing along with Colors config.

api.title: Icon config service API
api.ColorConfig: Object where key is color name and value is valid CSS color.
api.setColors: Used to merge new colors into config or update existing colors.
api.getBoxShadowColor: Return color that you can use as box shadow color.
api.getHoverColor: Return color that you can use as hover color.
api.getFocusColor: Return color that you can use as focus color.
api.getGradientBackground: Return color that you can use as background css attribute.

cssVariables.title: Css Variables
cssVariables.description: Vuestic UI extracts css as [CSS variables (custom properties)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Using_CSS_custom_properties)[[target=_blank]]. No need to install any loaders or additional packages to override components styles. You can deeply customize components by using simple syntax to change css in your project.

convention.title: Convention
convention.description: Vuestic UI uses the following convention to organize CSS Variables for more convenient use:

overriding.title: Overriding
overriding.description: You don't need any specific knowledge or packages. Just create file like `overrides.css`, import it into your main.js(ts) file and start redefining as easy as you write css properties:

default.title: Default
default.text: You can use left, center and right slots to pass items to navbar.

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: By default navbar uses `secondary` color. You can pass `color` props to change navbar background color. Also, text color depends on navbar background color. But you can pass own color if you want.

shape.title: Shape
shape.text: You can add the shape to navbar background. Shape color will be taken automatic from `color` prop.

buttonDropdown.title: Button Dropdown
buttonDropdown.summaryText: This is a button that displays drop-down content when clicked.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, wrap your content in `va-button-dropdown` component.

split.title: Split
split.text: You can split the button in two.

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: You can use the same styles as in `va-button`.

icons.title: Icons
icons.text: You can set the dropdown icon.

clickInside.title: Click inside
clickInside.text: You could set the dropdown to be closed or not after clicking on its content.

props.title: Sets the title of the popover
props.message: Message which showed in a popover
props.trigger: Event on which popover is triggered
props.autoHide: Adds the ability to hide popover when clicked outside

popover.title: Popover
popover.summaryText: A `va-popover` can be used to display some text on top of the component.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: Wrap your component in a `va-popover` tag and provide a message property with text.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can set different background colors to the component.

placement.title: Placement
placement.text: A component can be set in a different position. Use a position property to set it: `top`, `left`, `right` and `bottom` are available.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can set an icon to the component.

title.title: Title
title.text: You can set a title to the popover.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.text: Events triggering the popover separated with spaces: `hover`, `click` or `focus`.

typography.title: Typography
typography.description: Vuestic UI uses the following typography styling

uiElementGuide.title: UI Element Requirements
uiElementGuide.description: This page is intended for vuestic-ui contributors: it describes the requirements for UI elements.

description.userExpectations: Components should be as user expects them to be. We achieve that by checking refs ([Vuetify](https://vuetifyjs.com)[[target=_blank]], [Quasar](https://quasar.dev)[[target=_blank]], [Ant Design](https://ant.design)[[target=_blank]], [iView](http://iview.talkingdata.com)[[target=_blank]], [Element UI](https://element.eleme.io)[[target=_blank]], etc.).
description.qualityComponents: Components should be of high quality. We achieve that by manually testing edge cases + refactoring early.

description.visualFeedback: **Visual feedback** - When user interacts with component they should see result of their actions (could be implemented with :active selector or somehow else depending on case).
description.keyboardNavigation: **Keyboard navigation** - You must ensure that UI elements are keyboard accessible, and you must disable this functionality for elements that should not receive keyboard focus.
